title: Mathematics-Based Attitude Change Education: Activity-Centered Online Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: College-Level Foundational Mathematical Knowledge and Experience Applying Mathematics to Job-Related Tasks
context.additional_context: For current practitioners needing enhanced flexible thinking and collaborative skills in math problem-solving. Real-time interactive classroom environment using digital devices (laptops/tablets)

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three creative approaches that break away from stereotypes when solving math problems.
Learners can develop two practical cases applying mathematical thinking through collaborative projects.
Learners can improve their mathematical problem-solving attitudes with over 80% participation in online discussions and feedback activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
